results.title: The Small farm in America
results.brief_description: An inquiry into the forces promoting large-scale agriculture while forcing small farmers off the land, a plea for a return to the small farm, and a look at some of those who are trying it. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Sleeping tiger
results.brief_description: Directed by Joseph Losey in 1954, “The Sleeping Tiger” was his first feature made in Britain which came to typify what was later referred to as, ‘Losey Baroque’. In this domestic drama, criminal Frank Clements (Dirk Bogarde) becomes a ‘home-trial’ case patient for psychologist, Dr. Clive Esmond (Alexander Knox) and inadvertently his wife, Glenda (Alexis Smith). Forced to undergo psychoanalytic reform in place of a prison sentence, Frank proceeds to provoke emotional conflict in all their relationships. Frank with his excessive passions, and Clive with his emotionally detached approach provide great shadow plays. As Freudian displacement eventuates the themes of disaffection, frustration and alienation spark dramatic changes in all their lives. Dr. Esmond.” In the dark forest of every human personality there is a sleeping tiger.” Who will be freed from their compulsions? Based on the book of the same name by Maurice Moiseiwitsch.

results.title: The Six billion $$$ sell
results.creator_credit: Carole Kahn and Consumer Reports Films
results.brief_description: A combination of comedy, animation and an original pop theme song are used to expose the questionable techniques of TV commercials. Aims to make viewers aware of how advertising can influence attitudes, values and expectations and helps consumers develop a healthy scepticism about advertising. Illustrations of persuasive advertising techniques include promises, giveaways, star endorsements, word games and branch loyalty. Features Billy Crystal.

results.title: The Sitar
results.creator_credit: James Chimbioio and Hungry Mino Enterprise
results.brief_description: Details the origin, history, philosophy, ritual, composition and performance of classical Indian music and talks of its relationship with the Hindu religion. The basic musical form is the raga, and the sitar is now extensively used in this classical style. Enables the viewing of a sitar performance. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Silence and the night
results.brief_description: A mime on the street is performing his usual show. Some people stand watching him, some go by giving him a vacant look. A girl walks through the crowd and passes by without stopping, not looking at him. Has the mime seen her?
results.description: A mime on the street is performing his usual show. Some people stand watching him, some go by giving him a vacant look. A girl walks through the crowd and passes by without stopping, not looking at him. Has the mime seen her?

results.title: The Shadow of ignorance: An inquiry
results.brief_description: Venereal disease in Britain, a programme introduced by Jo Grimmond, M.P. It avoids moral issues, and concentrates on facts: the symptoms of infection, the confidential nature of treatment at a special clinic and the contact slips for patients to give to those who infected them. At the end, three patients are interviewed: a prostitute, a boy and a girl (who talks good sense about parental attitudes). To some extent it will discourage promiscuity; certainly by making it clear that treatment is neither embarrassing nor painful it will encourage those who suspect that they have been infected to seek treatment. Restriction: To be shows to members and students of the medical profession and nursing profession.

results.title: The Sexually mature adult
results.brief_description: From the moment of conception to the instance of death our lives as sexual beings are endless. The film covers the physiology and emotions involved in mature sexual behaviour during the four stages of sexual response in intercourse.

results.title: The Seventh continent (Anamorphic)
results.creator_credit: Dusan Vukoric, Fimove Studio Koliba and Jadran Film (Zagreb)
results.brief_description: Two runaway children discover a magical island, the Seventh Continent. Soon, children of various nationalities and races come to the Seventh Continent where they create a new world of fun and fantasy far from adults. A Yugoslav-Czech co-production. In cinemascope - requires an anamorphic lense.
